description: Very funny ..... lot's of setting that make no sense.

Yes, you need to understand a bit about how it sits between IMAP and O365 but it just sits there and does the job. Takes 10 mins to install and set up once you know what you're doing. If you don't know what you're doing you shouldn't be doing it. And it fixes MFA in a jiffy.
Brill
summary: Neat bit of software solves complex problem

description: Great tool, I'm connected to my outlook server company through OWA, it's working perfectly!
This lets you use any email/calendar application with MS Exchange. With Evolution-EWS dropped due to security flaws, DavMail is the only option.
App just shows the last message log: Starting DavMail Gateway
You need to go through docs to get it working
The same review as the Feb.20 review. Stuck on popup of last message and last log.
Great tool! Please keep up the great job!
I can't start the app. I get a popup with last log... The first time I started it I saw a menu which I couldn't access. Now it does not even show that.
summary: I get a popup with last log

description: Didn't run the davmail UI to allow me to set the ports myself, instead just showed me a log of two message with port IDs.

It doesn't work - and because I have a life to live and a job to do, I cannot afford to tinker my way with cryptic garbage on fifth tier forums. Look, I want to like Linux, I really do, but stuff like this just makes it impossible.

As always, the fanboys will huff and puff about how this is excellent and so much better than anything Microsoft have to offer and how it's just a matter of sudoingsome terminal and grabbing x64msemu_dll2lx_fkk0ff... I've seen and heard the Microsoft haters (sometimes I even am with them), but in the end, they go away. MS Exchange stays. It's such an essential part of work and private life it is beyond me how anyone can think Linux stands a dying chance without such core functionality.

It's a sad story, this.

I'll credit the dev for trying, though.
summary: This is just why I can't bond with Linux

description: Sounded like a interesting application but wouldn't load

The interface stinks. 
When you start DavMail, if any of the ports are blocked, 
it will throw an error without any "configure" button or 
menu in evidence. You have to figure which piece of text 
is doubling as a menu button. UGGGGH. Hint: it's one of 
the app names in the window. 

Second problem, the configuration itself is a guessing 
game. I tried all the combinations I could think of 
without luck. Essentially, getting this configured seems
to require convincing your sys admin to figure out the
config info for you. Good luck.

Follow the white rabbit, Neo
It does not run

To even be able to run it requires you to read the manual. This will tell you it requires jdk. No error message in the GUI whatsover about this. Only on the command line will it give you feedback. Then when it finally runs it's just a settings window. Would be nice if it gave some information about how it works but no the developer just assumes you know exactly how to use it or search for it yourself.
summary: Does NOT work out of the box, terrible UX

description: Better read the manual before though
Doesn't work on Ubuntu 19.04. It stuck at some popup where it shows Last message and Last log. There is no way to get to the settings menu.
sehr einfache und komfortable installation

Installiert. Starten funktioniert nicht. Ausgabe: 
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Can't load library: /usr/lib/jvm/java-11-openjdk-amd64/lib/libawt_xawt.so
soluciono mis problemas de puerto . gracias
me encanta mucho
summary: horible dice mi hermano pero ami me da lo mismo

description: Impossible d'installer l'application, Ubuntu m'indique de DavMail est en écoute sur STMP et plus rien...

Debian 10 Gnome 3.30.2 Evolution 3.30.5-1.1
N'a pas fonctionné du premier coup, mais c'était ma faute : l'URL du serveur doit être complète et j'avais omis https:// au début. Fonctionne très bien maintenant !
Did not work at first, but itwas my fault: the server URL needs to be complete and I forgot https:// at the beginning. Works nice now !
summary: Fonctionne très bien avec Evolution Works fine with Evolution
